moves.6... e5 7. Nb3 Be6: Black's best move, to cover the gaping hole on d5.
moves.8. f3 Nbd7 9. Qd2 Qc7 10. g4 b5: And the battle lines are drawn!
moves.11. g5 Nh5: Better was 11..b4 not allowing any of my pieces to occupy the d5 square. (a pawn would)
moves.14... g6: Black strives to develop his pieces. A quick glance at this board would have us noticing his undeveloped, terrible black bishop, bound by its own pawns, his knight on the wing, and his uncastled king. Three problems to solve, while my only issue is an uncastled king.
moves.15. c4: Trying to pry open the C-file for me to move a rook there.
moves.23. b4 Rb7: Of course, again, Ne6 loses to Bxe6, Rxc1, Bd7+...
moves.24. bxc5 dxc5 25. Rcb1 Bxg5 26. Nd5 Rxb1: The end follows quickly, my three pieces able to dominate his two.
